workflow.name: Automated daily posting to 9 social platforms with Google Sheets, Drive and Blotato
workflow.description:
## Description
This automation publishes to 9 social platforms daily! Manage your content in a simple Google Sheet. When you set a post's status to "Ready to Post" in your Google Sheet, this workflow grabs your image/video from your Google Drive, posts your content to 9 social platforms, then updates the Google Sheet post status to "Posted".

## Overview
**1. Trigger: Check Every 3 Hours**
- Check Google Sheet for posts with Status ""Ready to Post""
- Return 1 post that is ready to go

**2. Upload Media to Blotato**
- Fetch image/video from Google Drive
- Upload image/video to Blotato

**3. Publish to Social Media via Blotato**
- Connect your Blotato account
- Choose your social accounts
- Either post immediately or schedule for later
- Includes support for images, videos, slideshows, carousels, and threads

## Setup
- Sign up for [Blotato](https://www.blotato.com)
- Generate Blotato API Key by going to Settings > API > Generate API Key (paid feature only)
- Ensure you have "Verified Community Nodes" enabled in your n8n Admin Panel. Install "Blotato" community node.
- Create credential for Blotato.
- Connect your Google Drive to n8n: https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/credentials/google/oauth-single-service
- Copy this sample Google Sheet. Do NOT change the column names, unless you know what you're doing: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1v5S7F9p2apfWRSEHvx8Q6ZX8e-d1lZ4FLlDFyc0-ZA4/edit
- Make your Google Drive folder containing images/videos PUBLIC (i.e. Anyone with the link)
- Complete the 3 setup steps shown in BROWN sticky notes in this template

## Troubleshooting Checklist
- your Google Drive is public
- column names in your Google Sheet match the original example
- file size < 60MB; for large files, Google Drive does not work, use Amazon S3 instead

## ðŸ“„ Documentation
[Full Tutorial](https://help.blotato.com/api/templates/1-post-everywhere)

## Troubleshooting
Check your [Blotato API Dashboard](https://my.blotato.com/api-dashboard) to see every request, response, and error. Click on a request to see the details.

## Need Help?
In the Blotato web app, click the orange button on the bottom right corner. This opens the Support messenger where I help answer technical questions

parameters.content:
# Ready to Post
You can post text, images, videos, stories, slideshows, and carousels. 

## How Template Works
- Checks Google Sheet every 3 hours for new items with status "Ready to Post"
- Get 1 item that is ready to post (so you don't spam too many posts at the same time)
- Get unique Google Drive ID of media (image/video)
- Upload media to Blotato
- Post media and caption to social platforms
- Update item's status to "Posted" in Google sheet

## Setup
1. Sign up for Blotato.com
2. Generate Blotato API Key by going to Settings > API > Generate API Key (paid feature only)
3. Ensure you have "Verified Community Nodes" enabled in your n8n Admin Panel. Install "Blotato" community node.
4. Create credential for Blotato.
5. Connect your Google Drive to n8n: https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/credentials/google/oauth-single-service
6. Copy this sample Google Sheet. Do NOT change the column names, unless you know what you're doing:
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1v5S7F9p2apfWRSEHvx8Q6ZX8e-d1lZ4FLlDFyc0-ZA4/edit
7. Make your Google Drive folder containing images/videos PUBLIC (i.e. Anyone with the link)
8. Complete the 3 setup steps shown in BROWN sticky notes in this template

# Post Everywhere

## IMPORTANT
Do not post the same image/video over and over again, otherwise it will be flagged as spam. Make sure to disclose AI generated content if you're using avatars.

ðŸ‘‰  **Blotato API Docs**: https://help.blotato.com/api
âœ…  **Troubleshoot Errors**: https://my.blotato.com/api-dashboard
ðŸ“·  **Media Requirements**: https://help.blotato.com/api/media
ðŸ› ï¸  **Contact help**: log into blotato > click support button in bottom right corner

# Setup 2
Select your Blotato credential

### Troubleshooting Checklist:
- your Google Drive is public
- column names in your Google Sheet match the original example
- file size < 60MB; for large files, Google Drive does not work, use Amazon S3 instead

# Platform Specific Notes

## Tiktok
You can post images, videos, and slideshows. Your Tiktok account must be warmed up before using Blotato, otherwise you'll get low views. [Follow this warm up guide](https://help.blotato.com/platforms/tiktok/brand-new-accounts). 

Check out best practices and troubleshooting FAQs:
https://help.blotato.com/platforms/tiktok

## Linkedin
You can post text, images, videos, and PDF carousels. Check out best practices and troubleshooting FAQs:
https://help.blotato.com/platforms/linkedin

## Facebook
You can post text, images, regular videos, and reels. Check out best practices and troubleshooting FAQs
https://help.blotato.com/platforms/facebook

## Instagram
You can post images, reels, stories, and slideshows. Check out best practices and troubleshooting FAQs:
https://help.blotato.com/platforms/instagram

## Twitter
You can post text, images, and videos. You can post a long-form thread by clicking "Show Advanced Settings". Check out best practices and troubleshooting FAQs:
https://help.blotato.com/platforms/twitter

## Threads
You can post text, images, and videos. You can post a long-form thread by clicking "Show Advanced Settings". Check out best practices and troubleshooting FAQs:
https://help.blotato.com/platforms/threads

## Bluesky
You can post text, images, and videos. You can post a long-form thread by clicking "Show Advanced Settings". Check out best practices and troubleshooting FAQs:
https://help.blotato.com/platforms/bluesky

## Youtube
You can post Youtube shorts and long-form videos. You don't need to do anything. Youtube automatically posts Shorts if your video is <2 minutes and 9:16 aspect ratio.

Brand new Youtube accounts are limited to a few posts per day via API. You can still upload manually through Youtube website. This restriction is directly from Youtube and is gradually lifted as you post consistently.

Check out best practices and troubleshooting FAQs:
https://help.blotato.com/platforms/youtube

## Pinterest
You can post image and video pins. You must warm up your Pinterest account by posting a few pins per day, gradually ramping up.

How to Get Your Pinterest Board ID:
Go to Blotato, create a Pinterest post, click Publish, and you'll see your board IDs. Copy board ID to here.

Check out best practices and troubleshooting FAQs:
https://help.blotato.com/platforms/pinterest

## Need More Help?

Log into Blotato.com
Click support button in bottom right corner.
Sabrina RamonovðŸ„ replies within 24 hours most weekdays.

# Setup 3
1. Open each node
2. Select your social account
3. Deactivate platforms you don't need
3. ðŸ‘‰ **You don't need to do anything else!**

# Final Report

ðŸ‘‰ View run logs and results.

ðŸ‘‰ API Dashboard:
 https://my.blotato.com/api-dashboard
